intro: Columnea cuspidata, commonly known as the spurred gentian, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows as a shrub or vine, often climbing or trailing along supports. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and slightly hairy, while its flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of the stems. Columnea cuspidata thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
